Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as an attempt by the ALP government to impose censorship on social media.
Historical reference to former Minister Stephen Conroy's failed attempt at internet censorship, which faced backlash.
Concerns about the ACMA's role in developing 'misinformation codes' and its past involvement in creating a controversial blacklist.
The draft legislation is described as convoluted and difficult to understand, making it inaccessible to the general public.
Notable Quotes: When one strips away all the spin and perceived propaganda... it represents an attempt by the Albanese / ALP government to impose censorship of social media outlets on the internet.

Because of this apparent case of 'history repeating itself', I am opposed to these legislation amendments and the half-hearted attempt to pretend that they arenâ€™t just censorship of social media platforms.
